FDG.function_description: Track and manage daily activities

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the activity diary page (page 0). They perform a click action on the 'Woodworking' activity tag, which remains on the same page (page 0). This action likely tracks or manages the Woodworking activity, with no branching logic as only one action is present.

steps.summary: Click on the Woodworking activity tag

FDG.function_description: The current page (a side menu) in the Activity Diary app provides navigation options to select an activity, view the diary, add or edit activities, access settings, and learn about the app, enabling users to manage and navigate through different features related to tracking daily activities.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the main page (page 0). The user clicks the hamburger menu icon (action S1), which opens the side menu (page 1) with navigation options. From here, the user can choose to navigate to different features like selecting an activity, viewing the diary, adding/editing activities, accessing settings, or learning about the app, but the core step here is opening the side menu via the hamburger icon click.

steps.summary: Click the hamburger menu icon to open the side menu

FDG.function_description: The current page allows users to search for specific daily activities within the Activity Diary app, enabling them to locate and potentially manage or view details of tracked activities.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main Activity Diary page. They click the search icon (at position [864, 124]) to initiate the search functionality for daily activities. This action likely opens a search input or interface to locate specific tracked activities.

steps.summary: Click the search icon to start searching for activities

FDG.function_description: This page allows the user to edit the title and color of a daily activity (specifically "Woodworking") and provides options to save, delete, or cancel the changes.

core_logic.logic: The user starts by clicking the plus icon to add or edit the 'Woodworking' activity (step S1). Then, they can edit the activity title via the input field (S2) or adjust the activity color using the color selection bar (S3). For color adjustment, sliders for red, green, and blue can be modified (S4, S5, S6), and the color selection is confirmed (S7). Finally, the user can save the changes (S8), delete the activity (not shown in steps), or cancel (S9).

steps.summary: Click plus icon to access activity edit page
Click activity title input field to edit title
Click activity color selection bar to adjust color
Click red color adjustment slider
Click green color adjustment slider
Click blue color adjustment slider
Click SELECT button to confirm color selection
Click save activity button to save changes
Click close button to cancel changes

FDG.function_description: This page functions as a camera interface (likely for augmented reality or activity - related photo capture) that is accessed from the daily activity tracking and management page, enabling users to take photos or record videos, possibly for documenting activities or for AR - related tasks.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the activity diary page (page 0). They click the camera button, which navigates to the camera interface (page 3) for photo/video capture related to activities. The flow is a straight line with no branches or loops here.

steps.summary: Click the camera button to open the camera interface

FDG.function_description: The current page (a "Note" dialog) allows the user to input a note related to a daily activity (accessed via the edit button from the activity tracking page) and either confirm the input with "OK" or cancel the action with "CANCEL".

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the Edit button on the activity tracking page to open the Note dialog. Then, the user can either input text in the note field or click the CANCEL button to exit the dialog without saving. If inputting, the flow proceeds to the input step; if canceling, it returns to the activity page.

steps.summary: Click Edit button to open Note dialog
Click note text input field to enter text
Click CANCEL button to cancel note input

FDG.function_description: The current page of the Activity Diary Debug app allows users to track and manage daily activities by displaying a current activity (Woodworking with a 7-minute duration) and providing options to select from a list of predefined activities (e.g., Cinema, Swimming, Sleeping) or use camera/editing features.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 (menu open) and clicks the 'Select Activity' menu option. This action navigates to page 0, where the current activity (Woodworking, 7 min) and a list of predefined activities (e.g., Cinema, Swimming) are displayed, along with camera/edit options. The flow is a single step with navigation, no branches yet.

This action navigates to page 5, where the Diary page displays a list of daily activities with their timestamps and durations, allowing the user to view and track their activity history. FDG.function_description: The current page allows users to edit or add a new activity by specifying the activity title and selecting an activity color, with options to save, delete, or cancel the changes.

FDG.function_description: The "Manage Activities" page allows users to view, edit, and potentially add (via the '+' icon) different types of daily activities (e.g., Cinema, Cleaning, Cooking) for the purpose of tracking and managing their daily routines.

FDG.function_description: The Settings page for the Activity Diary app allows users to configure various options including date format, activity selection behavior, crash reporting, image storage and metadata, and conditions for activity sorting and sequencing.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the Settings menu option to enter the Settings page. From there, users can click on 'Alphabetical Sort info' or 'Activity Sequence info' (though the latter leads to a configuration dialog). In the Activity Sequence dialog, users can select a radio button (OFF, 1, 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 50) to set the sequence weight or click CANCEL to return to the Settings page.

steps.summary: Click Settings menu option to open Settings page
Click Alphabetical Sort info (optional, not part of main config flow here)
Click Activity Sequence info to open configuration dialog
Select OFF radio button in Activity Sequence dialog
Select 1 radio button in Activity Sequence dialog
Select 3 radio button in Activity Sequence dialog
Select 5 radio button in Activity Sequence dialog
Select 10 radio button in Activity Sequence dialog
Select 15 radio button in Activity Sequence dialog
Select 20 radio button in Activity Sequence dialog
Select 30 radio button in Activity Sequence dialog
Select 50 radio button in Activity Sequence dialog
